sources.title: The Cosmic Man
sources.description: Title: The Cosmic Man Summary: A spherical UFO proves to contain one alien visitor. How to deal with him? Investigators disagree... Directed by: Herbert S. Greene Actors: Production Company: Futura Productions Inc. Release Date: 17 February 1959 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.85 : 1 The latest UFO, a white globe levitating in a California canyon, is investigated by the Air Force, aided by physicist Karl Sorensen. Just big enough for one "man", the object seems impenetrable, but that night a half-invisible being visits the town, and a strange bundled-up man takes a room at Angela Green's mountain lodge, the investigators' headquarters. Sorensen thinks the Cosmic Man is benevolent, but to the colonel he represents either danger...or military advantage.

sources.title: Cosmic Man (1959)
sources.description: "The Cosmic Man" is a 1959 independent science fiction film directed by Herbert S. Greene. The movie features a narrative centered around an extraterrestrial messenger who arrives on Earth during the early stages of space exploration, promoting a message of peace and cooperation. However, the story unfolds against a backdrop of military skepticism and paranoia. The film begins with the United States Air Force (USAF) tracking an unidentified flying object, described as a white sphere, moving at extraordinary speeds. When it lands, Dr. Karl Sorenson, an astrophysicist, is called in to investigate. An electrical experiment on the sphere results in a potentially catastrophic outcome, leading to concern about its powers. Later, the Cosmic Man (played by John Carradine) appears in a ghostly form, warning that humans must change their ways to become part of the interplanetary community. He interacts with a young boy with a disability, symbolizing the hope for human kindness and understanding. Unfortunately, military personnel, driven by fear and mistrust, ultimately see the Cosmic Man as a threat.

sources.title: The Cosmic Man (1959) John Carradine, Bruce Bennett, Angela Greene | Sci-Fi Movie
sources.description:
Out of This Universe! The Thing That Could Destroy the Earth!
A strange sphere settles down in a California canyon, causing both the scientific and military communities to gather around to investigate.

Original title: The Cosmic Man (1959)

Colorized version: https://youtu.be/qjSAUzPH_kU

Director: Herbert S. Greene
Writer: Arthur C. Pierce
Stars: John Carradine, Bruce Bennett, Angela Greene
Genres: Adventure, Sci-Fi, Thriller


00:00 Full Movie (with subtitles)
04:42 Mysterious object found in a canyon sparks discussions about antigravity and potential space supremacy.
10:41 Military and scientists collaborate to investigate a mysterious craft with advanced technology from space.
17:03 Encounter with a mysterious cosmic object leads to intrigue and suspense in a military setting.
25:38 Encounter with an unknown cosmic being leads to suspicion of an invasion, mysterious events, and a plan to uncover the truth.
34:23 Scientists study a mysterious sphere with potential for unlimited electricity generation.
44:29 Scientists discuss the power and potential threat of a mysterious sphere, while aiming to establish communication with the Cosmic Man.
53:50 Extraterrestrial visitor warns Earth about the future of civilization and the need for a new way of thinking.
55:54 Late-night discussions about the Cosmic Man's threat and potential solutions unfold amidst chess games.
1:02:45:A mysterious Cosmic Man visits a family, plays chess, and leaves abruptly, causing concern and intrigue.

Just big enough for one "man", the object seems impenetrable, but that night a half-invisible being visits the town, and a strange bundled-up man takes a room at Angela Green's mountain lodge, the investigators' headquarters. Sorensen thinks the Cosmic Man is benevolent, but to the colonel he represents either danger...or military advantage.
